_exec_summary.SummaryText:
May 2011 Revision-5 Update

June 2009 Revision-4 Update

December 18, 2007 Revision-3 Update

November 25, 2005 Revision-2 Update

July 19, 2005 Revision-2

April 19, 2005

June 17, 2004 Previous Submission Date

26907 LDEQ Facility ID Number

Risk Management Planning (RMP) regulations are governed by the United States Environmental Protection Agency (USEPA) to require facilities already under OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) to develop and submit a formal risk management plan to assess the potential impacts of an accidental chemical release.  The RMP rule is divided into three programs, based on off-site chemical impacts of neighboring schools, residential areas, and other structures of public occupation.  Programs 1 and 2 apply to facilities that pose no or limited risk to the off-site receptors while Program 3 requires additional requirements to effectively monitor and create response controls.  Triggers for these programs exist based on risk, population density, SIC code, five-year accident history, PSM applicability, and if the facility exceeds threshold quantities of listed chemicals.  Facilities that maintain inventories of regulated chemicals in excess of threshold quantities, as defined in 40 CFR 68.130, are required to develop a RMP and submit registration information to the USEPA, and to coordinate with state and local emergency response and planning agencies.

Kinder Morgan Delta Terminal Services operates a bulk liquid storage terminal in Harvey, Louisiana.  Delta Terminal Services stores a variety of chemicals ranging from vegetable oils to volatile organic substances.  

This facility is regulated under the Program 2 rule requirements of 40 CFR 68.10 because:

It maintains storage inventories of Toluene 2, 4-diisocyanate (TDI), a listed toxic chemical, in excess of 10,000 lbs as defined by 40 CFR Part 68 Subpart G

A release from the Kinder Morgan Delta Terminal could impact off-site receptors (i.e., residences and business areas)

It does not ope

rate under a SIC code specified for Program 3 rule

It is not subject to OSHA PSM because PSM does not apply to flammable liquids stored in atmospheric tanks which are kept below their normal boiling point without benefit of chilling or refrigeration 40 CFR 1910.119(a)(1)(ii)(B) 

The May 2011 RMP is being revised from the June 2009 RMP revision to reflect the removal of Toluene 2,4-diisocyanate (TDI) and the addition of Ethylenediamine(EDA).  With the change of the new regulated chemical process and the location of the largest storage vessel (Tank 50-21), the worst case release endpoint radius has increased to 0.7 miles (from 0.4 miles in the June 2009 revision) and the affected population has increased to 3125 persons (from 970 persons in the June 2009 revision).

The facility has had no RMP accidents in the past five (5) years.
